title: Is plasma present in blood? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes.Plasma is yellowish Liquid component of Blood. About 55% of blood is plasma, and remanining are Red Blood cells, White Blood cells and platelet that are suspended in the plasma. Plasma is mostly water(up to 95% by volume and contains important dissolved proteins (6–8%)( e.g serum, albumin, fibrogen and globulin), glucose, clotting factors, electrolytes, hormone, carbon dioxide and oxygen. It plays a vital role in intravasular osmotic effect that keeps electrolyte concentration bbalanced and protects the body from infections and other blood disorders.

Plasma is a component of blood. Blood is made up of plama and cells like Red blood cella, white blood cells and platelets. Plasma forms the liquid part of blood in which red cells and other cells are present. Plasma is composed of water, proteins, etc.
